Have You Witnessed Nurses Give Medications? What steps were or were not performed? 7,000 - 9,000 die in U.S. medication error 100,000's adverse reaction or complications Medication errors costs over $40 billion annually Pain and suffering from medication errors Decreased satisfaction and trust Medication Errors... How Bad are They? 3 Checks: Pre & 1st Accuracy Check 2nd Accuracy Check 3rd Accuracy Check Decrease Risk of Medication Errors How to Learn a New Skill 1 Deconstruct the Skill • Break the skill into understandable parts 2 Learn Enough to Self- Correct • Practice and recognize when you are making mistakes and being successful 3 Remove Practice Barriers • Dedicate to practice no matter what happens 4 Practice 20 Hours • This is important! • Skill Practice Log Ban • Distractions • Self-doubt Josh Kaufman (TEDxTalks, 2013) Skill Practice Time Log • Bring to class • Add hours​ • In class​ • Out of class​ • Simulation Lab Open Lab​ • Monitoring progress​ • Dedicate to reach goal! Medication Administration Checklist & Check-off You must pass the Medication Administration Skill to pass the course 3 attempts to be successful Remediation in Simulation Lab is required before attempting again Starred (*) items must be performed correctly or will be a failure Two unstarred (*) items will indicate a failure Open Lab is encouraged! Schedule with Simulation Lab Faculty Practice is the key to success! "Do not practice until you get it right... practice until you can't possibly get it wrong" Medication Administration Checkoff List Medication Administration Checkoff Types of Errors Most Common Errors Not Aspirating Documenting incorrectly Incorrect dosage calculations Holding medications incorrectly Using Orders accuracy checks Not scanning Not verifying patient correctly Not washing hands Thi s Photo by Unknown author is licensed under CC BY.
